action.action-desc: Ms. Salazar (for herself, Ms. Wasserman Schultz, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Waltz, Ms. Malliotakis, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, and Mr. McCaul) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To reauthorize the Venezuela Emergency Relief, Democracy Assistance, and Development Act of 2019, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the VERDAD Reauthorization Act.

section.header: Extension of sanctions imposed with respect to Venezuela

subsection.text: Section 165(c)(6) of the Russian-Venezuelan Threat Mitigation Act (22 U.S.C. 9753(c)(6)) is amended by striking the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act and inserting December 31, 2025.
Section 166(e) of the Venezuelan Arms Restriction Act (22 U.S.C. 9754(e)) is amended by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following new paragraph:
Section 183(b) of the Venezuela Emergency Relief, Democracy Assistance, and Development Act of 2019 (22 U.S.C. 9763) is amended by striking 2023 and inserting 2025.
